alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fairfax; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 5:18PM EDT until June 16 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Fairfax County in northern Virginia... The City of Manassas Park in northern Virginia... East central Prince William County in northern Virginia... The City of Manassas in northern Virginia... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 518 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Centreville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Centreville, Dale City, Fort Belvoir, Woodbridge, Lake Ridge, Burke, Chantilly, Montclair, Lorton, Bull Run, Newington, Manassas, West Springfield, Sudley, Cherry Hill, Manassas Park, Fairfax Station, Independent Hill, Mason Neck and Occoquan. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fairfax; Prince William
